se.lypson.common.gui.graphics
Class WindowStack

java.lang.Object
  se.lypson.common.gui.graphics.WindowStack

public class WindowStack
extends java.lang.Object

A stack simplifying storing and restoring windows in a Graphics instance. A window consists of an origo translation point and a clip rectangle.

Author:
Tobias Persson

empty

public boolean empty()
Tests if the stack is empty.

pushWindow

public void pushWindow(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int width,
                       int height)
Pushes the current drawing window into the stack and applies a new window. The window consists of an origo translation point and a clip rectangle. After calling this method, the Graphics instance' translation point is set to the specified point and the clip rectangle is set to a rectangle with the specified width and height and the translated origo as the clips upper left corner.

Parameters:
g - the instance whose translation point and clip rectangle should be pushed into the stack and replaced with new values.
x - the new origos horizontal position.
y - the new origos vertical position.
width - the width of the new clip area.
height - the height of the new clip area.

popWindow

public void popWindow(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g)
Restores the translation point and clip rectangle from the stack.

Parameters:
g - the instance whose translation point and clip rectangle should be popped from the stack.
